lustre/tests/mpi/write_disjoint.c

00026 /*
00027  * Copyright (c) 2003, 2010, Oracle and/or its affiliates. All rights reserved.
00028  * Use is subject to license terms.

00032 /*
00033  * This file is part of Lustre, http://www.lustre.org/
00034  * Lustre is a trademark of Sun Microsystems, Inc.
00035  *
00036  * lustre/tests/write_disjoint.c
00037  *
00038  * Each loop does 3 things:
00039  *   - rank 0 truncates to 0
00040  *   - all ranks agree on a random chunk size
00041  *   - all ranks race to write their pattern to their chunk of the file
00042  *   - rank 0 makes sure that the resulting file size is ranks * chunk size
00043  *   - rank 0 makes sure that everyone's patterns went to the right place
00044  *
00045  * compile: mpicc -g -Wall -o write_disjoint write_disjoint.c
00046  * run:     mpirun -np N -machlist <hostlist file> write_disjoint
00047  *  or:     pdsh -w <N hosts> write_disjoint
00048  *  or:     prun -n N [-N M] write_disjoint
00049  */
00050 
00051 #include <stdlib.h>
00052 #include <stdio.h>
00053 #include <sys/types.h>
00054 #include <sys/stat.h>
00055 #include <fcntl.h>
00056 #include <string.h>
00057 #include <errno.h>
00058 #include <unistd.h>
00059 #include <stdarg.h>
00060 #include "mpi.h"
00061 
00062 #define CHUNK_MAX_SIZE 123456
00063 
00064 void rprintf(int rank, int loop, const char *fmt, ...)
00065 {
00066         va_list       ap;
00067 
00068         printf("rank %d, loop %d: ", rank, loop);
00069 
00070         va_start(ap, fmt);
00071 
00072         vprintf(fmt, ap);
00073 
00074         MPI_Abort(MPI_COMM_WORLD, -1); /* This will exit() according to man */
00075 }
00076 
00077 #define CHUNK_SIZE(n) chunk_size[(n) % 2]
00078 
00079 int main (int argc, char *argv[]) {
00080         int i, n, fd, c;
00081         unsigned long chunk_size[2];
00082         int rank, noProcessors, done;
00083         int error;
00084         off_t offset;
00085         char **chunk_buf;
00086         char *read_buf;
00087         struct stat stat_buf;
00088         ssize_t ret;
00089         char *filename = "/mnt/lustre/write_disjoint";
00090         int numloops = 1000;
00091         int random = 0;
00092 
00093         error = MPI_Init(&argc, &argv);
00094         if (error != MPI_SUCCESS)
00095                 rprintf(-1, -1, "MPI_Init failed: %d\n", error);
00096         /* Parse command line options */
00097         while ((c = getopt(argc, argv, "f:n:")) != EOF) {
00098                 switch (c) {
00099                 case 'f':
00100                         filename = optarg;
00101                         break;
00102                 case 'n':
00103                         numloops = strtoul(optarg, NULL, 0);
00104                         break;
00105                 }
00106         }
00107 
00108         MPI_Comm_size(MPI_COMM_WORLD, &noProcessors);
00109         MPI_Comm_rank(MPI_COMM_WORLD, &rank);
00110 
00111         chunk_buf = malloc(noProcessors * sizeof(chunk_buf[0]));
00112         for (i=0; i < noProcessors; i++) {
00113                 chunk_buf[i] = malloc(CHUNK_MAX_SIZE);
00114                 memset(chunk_buf[i], 'A'+ i, CHUNK_MAX_SIZE);
00115         }
00116         read_buf = malloc(noProcessors * CHUNK_MAX_SIZE);
00117 
00118         if (rank == 0) {
00119                 fd = open(filename, O_WRONLY|O_CREAT|O_TRUNC, 0666);
00120                 if (fd < 0)
00121                         rprintf(rank, -1, "open() returned %s\n",
00122                                 strerror(errno));
00123         }
00124         MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00125 
00126         fd = open(filename, O_RDWR);
00127         if (fd < 0)
00128                 rprintf(rank, -1, "open() returned %s\n", strerror(errno));
00129 
00130         for (n = 0; n < numloops; n++) {
00131                 /* reset the environment */
00132                 if (rank == 0) {
00133                         ret = truncate(filename, 0);
00134                         if (ret != 0)
00135                                 rprintf(rank, n, "truncate() returned %s\n",
00136                                         strerror(errno) );
00137                         random = rand();
00138                 }
00139                 MPI_Bcast(&random, 1, MPI_INT, 0, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00140                 CHUNK_SIZE(n) = random % CHUNK_MAX_SIZE;
00141 
00142                 if (n % 1000 == 0 && rank == 0)
00143                         printf("loop %d: chunk_size %lu\n", n, CHUNK_SIZE(n));
00144 
00145                 if (stat(filename, &stat_buf) < 0)
00146                         rprintf(rank, n, "error stating %s: %s\n",
00147                                 filename, strerror(errno));
00148 
00149                 if (stat_buf.st_size != 0)
00150                         rprintf(rank, n, "filesize = %lu. "
00151                                 "Should be zero after truncate\n",
00152                                 stat_buf.st_size);
00153 
00154                 MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00155 
00156                 /* Do the race */
00157                 offset = rank * CHUNK_SIZE(n);
00158                 lseek(fd, offset, SEEK_SET);
00159 
00160                 done = 0;
00161                 do {
00162                         ret = write(fd, chunk_buf[rank] + done,
00163                                     CHUNK_SIZE(n) - done);
00164                         if (ret < 0 && errno != EINTR)
00165                                 rprintf(rank, n, "write() returned %s\n",
00166                                         strerror(errno));
00167                         if (ret > 0)
00168                                 done += ret;
00169                 } while (done != CHUNK_SIZE(n));
00170 
00171                 MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00172 
00173                 /* Check the result */
00174                 if (stat(filename, &stat_buf) < 0)
00175                         rprintf(rank, n, "error stating %s: %s\n",
00176                                 filename, strerror(errno));
00177 
00178                 if (stat_buf.st_size != CHUNK_SIZE(n) * noProcessors) {
00179                         if (n > 0)
00180                                 printf("loop %d: chunk_size %lu, "
00181                                        "file size was %lu\n",
00182                                        n - 1, CHUNK_SIZE(n - 1),
00183                                        CHUNK_SIZE(n - 1) *noProcessors);
00184                         rprintf(rank, n, "invalid file size %lu"
00185                                 " instead of %lu = %lu * %u\n",
00186                                 (unsigned long)stat_buf.st_size,
00187                                 CHUNK_SIZE(n) * noProcessors,
00188                                 CHUNK_SIZE(n), noProcessors);
00189                 }
00190 
00191                 if (rank == 0) {
00192                         if (lseek(fd, 0, SEEK_SET) < 0)
00193                                 rprintf(rank, n, "error seeking to 0: %s\n",
00194                                         strerror(errno));
00195 
00196                         done = 0;
00197                         do {
00198                                 ret = read(fd, read_buf + done,
00199                                            CHUNK_SIZE(n) * noProcessors - done);
00200                                 if (ret < 0)
00201                                         rprintf(rank, n, "read returned %s\n",
00202                                                 strerror(errno));
00203 
00204                                 done += ret;
00205                         } while (done != CHUNK_SIZE(n) * noProcessors);
00206 
00207                         for (i = 0; i < noProcessors; i++) {
00208                                 char command[4096];
00209                                 int j;
00210                                 
00211                                 if (!memcmp(read_buf + (i * CHUNK_SIZE(n)),
00212                                             chunk_buf[i], CHUNK_SIZE(n)))
00213                                         continue;
00214 
00215                                 /* print out previous chunk sizes */
00216                                 if (n > 0)
00217                                         printf("loop %d: chunk_size %lu\n",
00218                                                n - 1, CHUNK_SIZE(n - 1));
00219 
00220                                 printf("loop %d: chunk %d corrupted "
00221                                        "with chunk_size %lu, page_size %d\n",
00222                                        n, i, CHUNK_SIZE(n), getpagesize());
00223                                 printf("ranks:\tpage boundry\tchunk boundry\t"
00224                                        "page boundry\n");
00225                                 for (j = 1 ; j < noProcessors; j++) {
00226                                         int b = j * CHUNK_SIZE(n);
00227                                         printf("%c -> %c:\t%d\t%d\t%d\n",
00228                                                'A' + j - 1, 'A' + j,
00229                                                b & ~(getpagesize()-1), b,
00230                                                (b + getpagesize()) &
00231                                                ~(getpagesize()-1));
00232                                 }
00233 
00234                                 sprintf(command, "od -Ad -a %s", filename);
00235                                 ret = system(command);
00236                                 rprintf(0, n, "data check error - exiting\n");
00237                         }
00238                 }
00239                 MPI_Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
00240         }
00241 
00242         printf("Finished after %d loops\n", n);
00243         MPI_Finalize();
00244         return 0;
00245 }
